panels.description: Busy state of all CPU cores together

targets.expr: (sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode!="idle"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))) * 100

panels.title: CPU Busy

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode="system"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))
targets.legendFormat: Busy System

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode="user"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))
targets.legendFormat: Busy User

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode="iowait"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))
targets.legendFormat: Busy Iowait

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode=~".*irq"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))
targets.legendFormat: Busy IRQs

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode!='idle',mode!='user',mode!='system',mode!='iowait',mode!='irq',mode!='softirq'}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))
targets.legendFormat: Busy Other

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode="idle"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))
targets.legendFormat: Idle

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

panels.description: Disk space used of all filesystems mounted

targets.legendFormat: {{mountpoint}}

panels.title: Disk Space Used Basic

matcher.options: Idle - Waiting for something to happen
Iowait - Waiting for I/O to complete
Nice - Niced processes executing in user mode
Steal - Time spent in other operating systems when running in a virtualized environment
System - Processes executing in kernel mode
User - Normal processes executing in user mode

names: System - Processes executing in kernel mode

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode="system"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))
targets.legendFormat: System - Processes executing in kernel mode

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode="user"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))
targets.legendFormat: User - Normal processes executing in user mode

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode="nice"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))
targets.legendFormat: Nice - Niced processes executing in user mode

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode="iowait"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))
targets.legendFormat: Iowait - Waiting for I/O to complete

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode="irq"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))
targets.legendFormat: Irq - Servicing interrupts

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode="softirq"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))
targets.legendFormat: Softirq - Servicing softirqs

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode="steal"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))
targets.legendFormat: Steal - Time spent in other operating systems when running in a virtualized environment

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode="idle"}[$__rate_interval])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[$__rate_interval])))
targets.legendFormat: Idle - Waiting for something to happen

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: Apps - Memory used by user-space applications
PageTables - Memory used to map between virtual and physical memory addresses
SwapCache - Memory that keeps track of pages that have been fetched from swap but not yet been modified
Slab - Memory used by the kernel to cache data structures for its own use (caches like inode, dentry, etc)
Cache - Parked file data (file content) cache
Buffers - Block device (e.g. harddisk) cache
Unused - Free memory unassigned
Swap - Swap space used
Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working
{{device}} - Receive
{{device}} - Transmit
{{mountpoint}}
{{device}} - Reads completed
{{device}} - Writes completed
{{device}} - Successfully read bytes
{{device}} - Successfully written bytes
{{device}}

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_guest_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode="user"}[1m])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[1m])))
targets.legendFormat: Guest - Time spent running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system

targets.expr: sum by(instance) (irate(node_cpu_guest_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job", mode="nice"}[1m])) / on(instance) group_left sum by (instance)((irate(node_cpu_seconds_total{instance="$node",job="$job"}[1m])))
targets.legendFormat: GuestNice - Time spent running a niced guest  (virtual CPU for guest operating system)

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: Inactive - Memory which has been less recently used.  It is more eligible to be reclaimed for other purposes
Active - Memory that has been used more recently and usually not reclaimed unless absolutely necessary

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: Committed_AS - Amount of memory presently allocated on the system
CommitLimit - Amount of  memory currently available to be allocated on the system

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: Inactive_file - File-backed memory on inactive LRU list
Inactive_anon - Anonymous and swap cache on inactive LRU list, including tmpfs (shmem)
Active_file - File-backed memory on active LRU list
Active_anon - Anonymous and swap cache on active least-recently-used (LRU) list, including tmpfs
Writeback - Memory which is actively being written back to disk
WritebackTmp - Memory used by FUSE for temporary writeback buffers
Dirty - Memory which is waiting to get written back to the disk

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working
ShmemHugePages - Memory used by shared memory (shmem) and tmpfs allocated  with huge pages
ShmemHugePages - Memory used by shared memory (shmem) and tmpfs allocated  with huge pages

targets.legendFormat: Mapped - Used memory in mapped pages files which have been mmaped, such as libraries
Shmem - Used shared memory (shared between several processes, thus including RAM disks)
ShmemHugePages - Memory used by shared memory (shmem) and tmpfs allocated  with huge pages
ShmemPmdMapped - Ammount of shared (shmem/tmpfs) memory backed by huge pages
SUnreclaim - Part of Slab, that cannot be reclaimed on memory pressure
SReclaimable - Part of Slab, that might be reclaimed, such as caches
VmallocChunk - Largest contigious block of vmalloc area which is free
VmallocTotal - Total size of vmalloc memory area
VmallocUsed - Amount of vmalloc area which is used

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: Bounce - Memory used for block device bounce buffers
AnonHugePages - Memory in anonymous huge pages
AnonPages - Memory in user pages not backed by files

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: KernelStack - Kernel memory stack. This is not reclaimable
PerCPU - Per CPU memory allocated dynamically by loadable modules
HugePages_Free - Huge pages in the pool that are not yet allocated
HugePages_Rsvd - Huge pages for which a commitment to allocate from the pool has been made, but no allocation has yet been made
HugePages_Surp - Huge pages in the pool above the value in /proc/sys/vm/nr_hugepages
HugePages - Total size of the pool of huge pages
Hugepagesize - Huge Page size
DirectMap1G - Amount of pages mapped as this size
DirectMap2M - Amount of pages mapped as this size
DirectMap4K - Amount of pages mapped as this size

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: Unevictable - Amount of unevictable memory that can't be swapped out for a variety of reasons
MLocked - Size of pages locked to memory using the mlock() system call
NFS Unstable - Memory in NFS pages sent to the server, but not yet commited to the storage
Pagesin - Page in operations
Pagesout - Page out operations

matcher.options: Hardware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working
Pgfault - Page major and minor fault operations

targets.legendFormat: Pgfault - Page major and minor fault operations
Pgmajfault - Major page fault operations
Pgminfault - Minor page fault operations
{{device}} - Receive
{{device}} - Transmit
{{device}} - Receive errors
{{device}} - Rransmit errors
{{ device }} - ARP entries
NF conntrack entries
NF conntrack limit
{{ device }} - Speed
{{ device }} - Bytes
CPU {{cpu}} - Processed
CPU {{cpu}} - Dropped
{{ device }} -   Interface transmit queue length
{{interface}} - Operational state UP
{{device}} - Physical link state
{{collector}} - Scrape duration
{{collector}} - Scrape success
{{collector}} - Scrape textfile error (1 = true)
